title: Calories in a Chicken Leg
meta_description: Discover calories in a chicken leg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Bone-in, skin-on chicken leg quarter (drumstick + thigh), roasted without added oil or sauce; ~130 g edible portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken size, cooking method, skin removal, and seasonings. Check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One roasted chicken leg with skin provides ~284 kcal and ~38 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a chicken leg with skin?
faqs.a: About 284 kcal for one roasted, bone-in chicken leg with skin.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a chicken leg?
faqs.a: Roughly 38 g protein per chicken leg under standard assumptions.

faqs.q: Does removing the skin reduce calories in a chicken leg?
faqs.a: Yes, skinless drops it to ~184 kcal by cutting ~100 kcal of fat.

faqs.q: Are chicken legs high in fat?
faqs.a: With skin, yesâ€”~14 g total fat, including 4 g saturated; skinless is lower at ~5 g fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in a chicken leg?
faqs.a: Roasting or grilling keeps it lower; frying adds ~40+ kcal from oil absorption.
